testimony.name: Bob Martin [Fake]
key_points: Cannot afford housing under City of Yes due to low income ($20,000/year)
City of Yes will not benefit poor people like him
New developments in his area are unaffordable despite having good credit
City of Yes will only benefit the wealthy
Works multiple jobs (McDonald's and construction) but still can't afford housing
Concerns about displacement of current residents
Criticizes organizations supporting the plan (Open Plans, Open New York, Tri-State, Regional Plan Association, Transportation Alternatives)

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: I was doing some research and these I see the rules said that yet to make 80% AMI to be able to live in the city of yes.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote indicates that the speaker is aware of the income requirements related to the Universal Affordability Preference (UAP) element of the proposal, which targets households earning a percentage of the Area Median Income (AMI).

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: I cannot afford that. I make I make $20,000 a year. I don't make $89,000 a year.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker is discussing his inability to afford housing under the proposed UAP, which is a key element of the City of Yes for Housing Opportunity proposal.
